item.description: Biography Daniel Guterding is a Quantitative Analyst at Eurex, the largest European futures and options market, where he analyses derivatives trading data. On previous industry jobs, he worked on computational models for derivatives pricing in the foreign exchange (FX) market and other software projects. He also lectures on Quantitative Finance at Technische Hochschule Mittelhessen. In academia, he completed a PhD thesis in theoretical physics on the subject of microscopic models for organic and iron-based superconductors.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Lectures Since 2018 I am a lecturer in Quantitative Finance. Winter 2018 Introduction to Stochastic Processes Lecture & Exercise course (2+2 hours/week) Given at Technische Hochschule Mittelhessen. Contents: Basic probability Random walks Martingales Markov chains Stochastic differential equations Ito calculus Monte Carlo simulation Exercise courses At Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main, where I studied physics, I served as a tutor for exercise courses of various lecturers.

item.title: Software
item.description: I maintain an account on Github to which I upload research codes that I deem useful for the community. These codes include: ctaux is a continuous-time auxiliary field Monte Carlo solver for quantum impurity models. It uses a representation of the Green's function in terms of Legendre polynomials. dhva is a code for calculating de Haas-van Alphen frequencies and electronic band masses from XCrySDen band-grid files. It works very similar to SKEAF by Rourke and Julian, but it is written in object-oriented C++ and offers different interpolation schemes.

item.title: Service to the scientific community
item.description: In the broader field of finance and economy I serve as a referee for various journals, including the following: European Journal of Operational Research Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics I also serve as a referee for a broad variety of scientific journals in the field of physics, which include: Physical Review Letters Physical Review B (Condensed Matter and Materials Physics) Nano Letters
